name: Flea
religion: Flea falls into the "spiritual, not religious" category.
politicalViews: Flea is a Democrat--and likely liberal.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: He has not spoken about his religious views much, nor the religion of his upbringing–if there was one. Based on various quotes, it appears he might fall into the "spiritual, not religious" category. He once tweeted:

content.sourceTitle: Flea333: i love god i don't trust religion
content.text: I love god I don't trust religion.
When asked if he is spiritual he answered:

content.sourceTitle: Flea interview with Stern.de after Cologne Theatre Show.
content.text: There is a spiritual path in my life, I follow a long time. This is an important part of who I am…I'm not religious at all. But I believe in divine power, to something like a divine intelligence.
Flea seems to follow his own course toward spiritual happiness, rejecting the tenets of organized religion.
Flea appeared in a star-studded series called "Vote for Change", where he strongly and passionately endorsed Barack Obama for president in 2012, saying:

I love the United States of America. But these last years, it has been less of a place to love then I hoped that it could be. And I hope that Barack Obama can bring about the change for it to be a place to love wholly and fully with all that I am.
So, we can be assured that he leans toward the Democratic side of the fence.

content.sourceTitle: Anthony Kiedis and Dave Navarro Kissing
content.text: Furthermore, arguments can be made that Flea is pretty liberal. His best friend and bandmate, Anthony Kiedis, has admitted to being sexually experimental and some might classify him as bi-sexual.
When Obama came out in support of gay marriage, Flea took the opportunity at a Washington D.C. performance to make a comment, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Red Hot Chili Peppers Rock Out in D.C., Twitter Explodes with California Love
content.text: All this sanity – I like it!

content.sourceTitle: Red Hot Chili Peppers – Right on time (Sox on cox)
content.text: Plus, all the art, funk-pop antics of being almost naked on stage,

content.sourceTitle: Interview: The Red Hot Chili Peppers
content.text: the drugs and everything else that rock stars do
doesn't exactly foster a conservative worldview.
